DOC.brief_title: Text-Messaging Motivate Walking Older African Americans
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Older minority population benefit increased physical activity , especially walk . Text message intervention potential encourage positive change health behavior group . Purpose : To examine six week program motivational text messaging increase physical activity ( step count ) among old African Americans urban setting . Design : Randomized , control trial pilot study assignment motivational text message group control group . Setting/Participants : Thirty-six African Americans age 60 85 . Intervention : The intervention group receive motivational text message three time day , three day week , six week . Both group receive pedometer walk manual record step count . Study conduct analyzed 2011 . Main Outcome Measures : Primary outcome measure step count . Secondary outcome measure perceive activity level assess Leisure Time Exercise Questionnaire ( LTEQ ) . Results/Conclusion : In press - American Journal Preventive Medicine ( Jan 2013 )
